title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: Vrabel bloodied after jumping into practice scrum
content: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel jumped into a pile of players at Wednesday's practice with the Commanders and came out with a bloodied cheek, which caught the attention of players in the ensuing huddle.

title: Sources: Anthony, Sox finalizing 8-year extension
content: Rookie outfielder Roman Anthony and the Red Sox are finalizing an 8-year, $130 million extension that could escalate as high as $230 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Kelce on SB loss: 'Thrown that thing in the trash'
content: Tight end Travis Kelce said "I've thrown that thing in the trash," speaking of the Chiefs' blowout loss to the Eagles in Super Bowl LIX.

title: Tatum takes in Pats camp without walking boot
content: Jayson Tatum, who tore his Achilles tendon in May in the semifinals vs. the New York Knicks, was at New England Patriots training camp on Wednesday without his walking boot.

title: Rodgers 'on board' for preseason opener, if asked
content: Aaron Rodgers said he's open to playing in the Steelers' preseason opener vs. Jacksonville, if asked. "Whatever Mike [Tomlin] wants to do, I'm fully on board," he said.

title: Pawol to become first woman to ump MLB game
content: Jen Pawol, who worked spring training games the past couple of years, is set to become the first woman to umpire an MLB game, between the Marlins and Braves on Saturday.

title: Tua: Appointment to sports council 'an honor'
content: Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa called his appointment to the President's Council on Sports, Fitness and Nutrition "an honor."

title: ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üèà 20 NFL defenders ready to break out in 2025
content: Let's take a closer look at 20 intriguing second-year defensive players, including Quinyon Mitchell, Cooper DeJean, Jared Verse and Edgerrin Cooper.

title: Need an ace to win big? Even with large pockets, Mets refuse to overpay
content: Whether it's in free agency or at the trade deadline, David Stearns isn't compromising on his starting pitching philosophy.

title: Can loading up on relievers at the deadline win you a World Series? We found out
content: Contenders went all-in for relievers at this year's deadline. Here's how much bullpens really help in October.

title: 'Steal reps' and 'losing ground': How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's dad prepared him for the big moments. None will be bigger than 2025
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without stars.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: Keith Tkachuk on Matthew, Brady, Olympic gold and his Hall of Fame snub
content: "There's nothing better than seeing your kids do what they love to do best," Tkachuk said of his All-Star sons.

title: 2025 SEC football preview: Power Rankings, top players, must-see games
content: Our college football experts breakdown preseason SEC Power Rankings, plus games and players to watch this fall.

title: NFL draft prospects with the most at stake this season: Who can make a statement in 2025?
content: Which players' draft stocks have the most riding on the 2025 college football season? We picked out 10, including three quarterbacks.

title: How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Bulls return to MJ-era red pinstripes for new Statement uniforms
content: Jordan and the Bulls first wore the threads during the 1995-96 campaign when the team went 72-10 and won a championship.

title: Clippers' Harden surprised with court reveal, design on China tour
content: A basketball court with a larger-than-life image of James Harden was revealed in Guangzhou, China, on Monday.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League preview: Chelsea to contend? Will Man United rebound?
content: Ian Darke goes team-by-team to set up the 2025-26 Premier League season. Which clubs have improved this summer, and who could be in danger of relegation?

title: LaLiga's top 2025-26 kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Atl√©tico, more
content: The season starts next week (stream every match live on ESPN+), so let's take a look at what teams are wearing.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United tracking Fiorentina's Comuzzo
content: Fiorentina center back Pietro Comuzzo is being watched by Manchester United, Bournemouth and Sunderland. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Top 'Drumbeat' players: Bo Nix, Omarion Hampton among those generating buzz
content: Six potential league-winning players who are generating serious excitement in fantasy circles as the season draws closer.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Looking for late-season heroes? Six players to target
content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 wide receivers in Madden NFL 26
content: Amon-Ra St. Brown, CeeDee Lamb and others are near the top of Madden NFL 26's wide receiver rankings.

title: "Have To Act Accordingly": Shashi Tharoor Slams US For Additional 25% Tariffs
content: Slamming the United States for "double standard" for imposing an additional 25% tariff on India for buying Russian oil, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said US President Trump's move will make "our goods unaffordable to a lot of people in America."

title: "Not Going To Humiliate Myself": Brazil's Lula Rejects Talks With Trump
content: As US tariffs on Brazilian goods jumped to 50% on Wednesday, Brazil's President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva told Reuters that he saw no room for direct talks with US President Trump which he believes would turn into a "humiliation" for him.

title: "Sexual Violence By Parent Tears Through Foundational Fabric Of Familial Trust": Top Court
content: Observing incestuous sexual violence by a parent "tears through" the foundational fabric of familial trust, the Supreme Court has upheld a man's punishment for raping his minor daughter.

title: Air India Launches App For Emotional, Mental Well-Being Of Pilots, Cabin Crew
content: Tata Group-owned Air India has rolled out a dedicated emotional and mental well-being app for its pilots and cabin crew members and their families, offering over 600 expert-designed self-care techniques

title: Pro-Trump Nationalist President Nawrocki Becomes Poland's New President
content: Poland's new nationalist president, Karol Nawrocki, called for a "sovereign Poland" and promised to "fight those who are pushing the nation towards decline" as he was sworn in on Wednesday.

title: Trump Suggests Vance 'Most Likely' Republican Pick For 2028
content: US President Donald Trump suggested on Tuesday that Vice President JD Vance is "most likely" to secure the Republican party nomination for president in 2028.

title: YouTubers Attacked In Dharmasthala, 4 Hospitalised
content: Four men, representing three YouTube channels were attacked by a large mob near Dharmasthala in Dakshina Kannada district, when they were interviewing a person, amid an ongoing probe by SIT into the alleged mass burial case

title: Stanford Plans To Axe 363 Jobs Amid Trump's Funding Cuts
content: Stanford University plans to axe hundreds of staff due to funding cuts for higher education under President Donald Trump, the latest mass layoff at an elite US college.

title: Poll Body Sends Reminder To Tejashwi Yadav Amid Dual EPIC Card Row
content: The Election Commission has issued a reminder notice to Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly, Tejashwi Yadav, urging him to respond by August 8 regarding the alleged dual EPIC (Electors Photo Identity Card) matter.

title: Ghana Ministers Among 8 Killed In Helicopter Crash
content: Ghana's defence and environment ministers were killed in a helicopter crash Wednesday, the presidency said, hours after the armed forces reported a chopper carrying three crew and five passengers dropped off the radar.

title: Trump Cracks Down On Foreign Students, College Applications Rise Outside US
content: In China, wait times for US visa interviews are so long that some students have given up. Universities in Hong Kong are fielding transfer inquiries from foreign students in the US.

title: "Female, Male Army Officers Can't Be Evaluated For Permanent Commission On Same Criteria": Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday informed that female and male officers of the Indian Army, comprise two unequal and distinct classes, and can't be considered together for grant of permanent commission on the same criteria and cut-off marks.

title: 3 Family Members Beaten To Death By Relative Over Land Dispute
content: Three elderly members of a family were beaten to death by a 35-year-old neighbour in Jharkhand's Sahibganj district on Wednesday over a land dispute, police said.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Sunjay Kapur's Death Not Suspicious Says Surrey Police
content: Businessman Sunjay Kapur - who died last month while playing polo in London - died of natural causes, Surrey Police told NDTV.

title: Kerala Headmistress Booked For "Casteist Slur" Against Students
content: A case has been registered against the headmistress of an aided school for allegedly using casteist remarks against two fourth grade students and their parents in Haripad in the coastal district, police said on Wednesday.

title: Natural Disasters Caused $135 Billion In Economic Losses: Reinsurance Giant Swiss Re
content: Natural disasters caused $135 billion in economic losses globally in the first half of 2025, fuelled by the Los Angeles wildfires, reinsurer Swiss Re said Wednesday.

title: US Hypocrisy? 50% Tariff On India, Zero On EU That Bought Russian Oil
content: US President Donald Trump's announcement of 25 per cent additional tariffs on Indian goods triggered immediate diplomatic pushback from New Delhi and raised questions about Western consistency on Russian energy sanctions.

title: WhatsApp Launches New Safety Tool, 6.8 Million Scam Centre Accounts Banned
content: WhatsApp has launched a new 'safety overview', which will alert a user when someone not in their contact list adds them to a new WhatsApp group that they may not recognise, as Meta's messaging platform intensified its crackdown on scams and fraud.

title: Mamata Banerjee Condemns Alleged Attack On Bengali Migrants In Protest Rally
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday led a massive protest rally in Jhargram, condemning the alleged attacks on Bengali-speaking migrants outside the state.

title: 24-Year-Old Chain Snatcher Arrested In Delhi: Cops
content: The Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested a 24-year-old habitual offender for allegedly snatching a 30 gm gold chain from Tamil Nadu MP R Sudha near Tamil Nadu Bhavan in Chanakyapuri.

title: Tariff trap: Trump targets India to pressure Putin - but US may pay the price
content: Donald Trump imposed a 25% tariff on Indian goods due to India's Russian oil purchases. This action doubles existing tariffs. Analysts warn this could hurt US consumers and businesses. Clayton Seigle from CSIS, said tariffs may increase inflation. India is a key trade partner. The tariff could strain relations and impact global oil market stability.

title: PM Modi may visit China for the 1st time in 7 years; visit amid trade standoff with US
content: PM Narendra Modi is likely to visit China for the Shanghai Cooperation Summit in late August, hosted by President Xi Jinping. Preparations are underway for India's participation, with a potential bilateral meeting between Modi and Xi on the agenda.

title: Trump tariffs: Exporters on edge, fear losing orders
content: Indian businesses anticipate significant order losses during the festival season due to Donald Trump's 50% tariffs on exports to the US, making competition with other countries difficult. Exporters are hoping for a breakthrough in trade negotiations, but many orders are already on hold as buyers reassess sourcing. Diversification is challenging as China increases its focus on European and other markets.

title: Asim Munir‚Äôs grip on power deepens Pakistan‚Äôs militarisation
content: Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir's rise in Pakistan, following a military standoff with India, signals a shift towards greater military influence. Despite denials, speculation persists about his expanding role in civilian affairs. Amidst economic challenges and internal strife, Munir's hardline stance towards India and crackdown on dissent, including Imran Khan's imprisonment, raise concerns about the nation's trajectory.

title: 6-year-old PIO girl and Indian chef latest to be attacked in Ireland
content: A six-year-old Indian-origin girl in Waterford City was racially abused and physically assaulted by a group of teenagers, prompting outrage. In a separate incident, Laxman Das, an Indian sous chef in Dublin, was attacked and robbed while going to work. These incidents follow a series of recent assaults targeting Indians in Ireland, raising concerns about racism.

title: Terror funding: Special NIA court frames charges against Jamaat-e-Islami trio, trust
content: A special NIA court in Jammu has charged three Jamaat-e-Islami operatives and a trust for allegedly raising and using funds to promote the banned organization's activities, violating the UAPA. The accused include Amir Mohammad Shamsi, Abdul Hamid Ganai, and Pakistan-based Mushtaq Ahmad Mir, along with the Al-Huda Educational Trust. Evidence includes witness statements, financial records, and money transfers.

title: Omar writes to all political parties for J&K‚Äôs statehood, calls it ‚Äòessential course correction‚Äô
content: Jammu and Kashmir's Chief Minister, Omar Abdullah, has appealed to national parties, including the BJP, to reinstate statehood for J&K, emphasizing it as a constitutional right, not a discretionary favor. He argues that downgrading a state to a Union Territory sets a dangerous precedent, urging a bill in Parliament's current session.

title: RBI keeps rates on hold, cuts inflation estimate for FY26
content: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has decided to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, maintaining a neutral stance. While retaining the FY26 growth forecast at 6.5%, the MPC lowered the inflation projection to 3.1%. This decision considers macroeconomic conditions, the need for further transmission of rate cuts, and favorable monsoon conditions, despite lingering global trade challenges and geopolitical uncertainties.

title: Trump admin rolls back DOGE diktat: 'We communicated with agency HR leads that ...
content: The Trump administration has discontinued the weekly email directive, initiated by the Department of Government Efficiency under Elon Musk, that required federal workers to list five accomplishments. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) stated the policy was inefficient and will transition agencies to stricter performance management systems with regular employee check-ins.

title: Trump's 50% tariff shock: How will it impact Indian economy? Explained
content: US President Trump's imposition of a 25% additional tariff on Indian exports due to Russian oil purchases is poised to negatively impact India's economy, particularly affecting textile, marine, and leather sectors. Experts view this as a pressure tactic amid ongoing trade deal negotiations, potentially hindering India's GDP growth and straining trade relations.

title: Mohammed Siraj's classy reply to Owaisi's viral 'poora khol' comment
content: India defeated England by six runs in the final Test, leveling the series. Mohammed Siraj took five wickets, earning praise from Asaduddin Owaisi. Siraj was named Player of the Match. Shubman Gill captained the team after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's retirements. Gill also received the Player of the Series award.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Trump hints at shifting peace deal deadline; aide holds 'productive' talks
content: US envoy Steve Witkoff met with Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin for three hours amidst efforts to end the Ukraine war. This meeting occurred before a deadline for Russia to agree to peace or face new sanctions. Donald Trump hinted at diplomatic progress, stating the meeting was "highly productive.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing Meta's Job Offer; Zuckerberg launched a full-scale ‚Ä¶
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: 'Attempt to blackmail India': Rahul on Trump's extra 25% tariff; targets PM
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized US President Trump's increased tariffs on India as "economic blackmail" to force an unfair trade deal. He alleged PM Modi's silence on the issue stems from a US investigation into Adani and potential exposure of financial links. India defended its right to pursue energy policies based on national interest amidst the tariff threats.

title: Brazil Protests 50% Tariffs at WTO; Lula Plans Talks with Modi, Xi
content: Brazil has approached the World Trade Organization regarding US tariffs. These tariffs impact a significant portion of Brazilian exports. President Lula intends to discuss the matter with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Xi Jinping. The US has also sanctioned a Brazilian Supreme Court Justice. This action is related to the trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro.

title: 'India enabling Putin's butchery': Ex-UK PM Johnson backs Trump's additional tariff; lauds US president
content: Boris Johnson has endorsed Donald Trump's decision to impose an additional 25% tariff on India, asserting it's a justified response to New Delhi's support for Vladimir Putin amidst the Ukraine conflict. Johnson criticized European nations, including Britain, for their reluctance to penalize countries funding Russia's war efforts.

title: Trump, Gretzky and Tkachuk to revive youth Presidential Fitness Test
content: Donald Trump's President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition includes Wayne Gretzky and Matthew Tkachuk. The Council will focus on fitness in schools. It aims to restore college athletic customs and protect women's sports. Matthew Tkachuk impressed the White House during the Florida Panthers' visit. He will help shape fitness programs for kids.

title: Marner trade rocks Leafs; buzz grows around possible Nick Robertson deal
content: Toronto Maple Leafs are in turmoil after trading Mitch Marner to Vegas Golden Knights. Nicolas Roy joined the Leafs. Nick Robertson is now a potential trade target, with Pittsburgh showing interest. Kyle Dubas, now with Pittsburgh, drafted Robertson. Robertson's future with the Leafs is uncertain. The team must decide if he is a long-term asset or a trade piece.

title: Magic Johnson praises Trinity Rodman for her latest achievement
content: Trinity Rodman marked her return from injury with a stunning game-winning goal for the Washington Spirit against the Portland Thorns, electrifying fans and earning praise from part-owner Magic Johnson. Despite a strained relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman, Trinity continues to excel, showcasing her talent and resilience on the field, adding to her impressive list of achievements.

title: Big revelation! 'It was Gautam Gambhir who insisted on this transition'
content: Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded Gautam Gambhir for his conviction and support of emerging talent during India's Test series in England, despite facing criticism. Sidhu highlighted Gambhir's role in providing opportunities to players like Akash Deep and Washington, emphasizing the team's spirited performance and commendable draw achieved despite missing key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

title: US army base in lockdown: 5 soldiers shot at in Georgia; shooter apprehended
content: A shooting at Fort Stewart-Hunter Army Airfield in Georgia left five soldiers injured, prompting a base-wide lockdown. The gunman is in custody, and authorities have confirmed there is no further threat.

title: Arshdeep mimics fan's 'Jaiswal' chant in girly voice, Yashasvi can't stop laughing
content: India secured a thrilling six-run victory against England in the fifth Test at The Oval, drawing the series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance, claiming 5 for 104 and 23 wickets in the series, earned him Player of the Match. A lighthearted moment followed as Arshdeep Singh playfully mimicked a fan chanting for Yashasvi Jaiswal, showcasing the team's camaraderie.

title: Kartavya Bhawan: PM Modi explains meaning behind name of India's new power hub
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated Kartavya Bhavan, the first building under the Common Central Secretariat project, symbolizing a shift from colonial-era administration to democratic values. The building will house key ministries and aims to improve efficiency, save taxpayer money, and provide modern amenities. Modi emphasized that policies for a developed India will be framed in these Kartavya Bhavans.

title: 50% US duty on India: Trump threatens more tariff; leaves door open for talks
content: Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on India due to its continued purchase of Russian crude oil, despite prior warnings. Trump stated India is 'fuelling the war machine' and expressed dissatisfaction with the trade relationship. India's foreign ministry has defended its position, citing national interests and accusing the US and EU of hypocrisy in their own dealings with Russia.

title: LeBron joins Savannah for Pilates after workout near Clippers banner
content: LeBron James is gearing up for his 23rd NBA season, prioritizing fitness to maintain peak performance. He's been spotted engaging in rigorous workouts, including Pilates sessions with his wife, Savannah. Their joint fitness efforts have garnered attention, with fans reacting to their dedication and speculating about James' future in the league.

title: Trump‚Äôs tariff treasure: US 'taking in so much money' ‚Äì but where is it going?
content: US President Trump touts billions in tariff revenue, but its use remains unclear. While the government collected nearly $30 billion last month alone, a 242% increase, the funds enter a general Treasury pool. Trump proposed debt reduction or rebates, yet neither materialized.

title: Helicopter crash in Ghana: 8 killed; defence, environment ministers among dead
content: A devastating helicopter crash in Ghana has claimed the lives of eight individuals, including two prominent government ministers: the defence minister and the environment minister. The helicopter, en route to a gold-mining region, lost contact before the tragic incident. Investigations are underway to determine the cause of this national tragedy, marking one of Ghana's worst aviation disasters in recent years.

title: Shubman Gill's full list of records from the England series
content: Shubman Gill's stellar performance led India to a 2-2 series draw in England, despite the absence of key players. Gill amassed 774 runs, averaging 75.40, with four centuries. His remarkable scores included a high of 269 at Edgbaston.

title: 'Direction of nation will be decided from here': What PM Modi said at Kartavya Bhawan
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated the first Kartavya Bhavan at Kartavya Path in Delhi, marking a significant step towards a developed India. He emphasized that the building symbolizes India's transformation and will be a hub for shaping policies for a 'Viksit Bharat'. The new complex aims to modernize administrative infrastructure, fostering collaboration among ministries and saving approximately Rs 1,500 crore annually.

title: SC to ECI: Explain 65L missing Bihar voters; ADR questions mass deletions
content: The Supreme Court has directed the election commission of India (ECI) to provide detailed information by August 9 regarding the removal of approximately 65 lakh voters from Bihar's draft electoral rolls. This directive follows a plea by an NGO seeking clarity on the reasons for these deletions, whether due to death, relocation, or other factors.

title: PM Modi likely to visit China: First trip to Beijing since 2020 Galwan clash
content: Narendra Modi will visit China for the SCO Summit. This is his first visit since the Galwan clash. The visit happens amid trade issues with the United States. Donald Trump threatens higher tariffs on India. India defends its energy strategy. Ajit Doval is in Moscow for talks on strategic partnership. Discussions will include Russian oil supplies to India.

title: Happy Raksha Bandhan 2025: Wishes, quotes, images, gIFs & messages
content: Raksha Bandhan, a Hindu festival, celebrates the bond between siblings. Sisters tie Rakhi on their brother's wrist. This signifies love and protection. The article provides messages, quotes, and wishes for Raksha Bandhan 2025. It includes images and GIFs for the festival. The content focuses on expressing love and strengthening sibling relationships. It shares greetings for a joyous celebration.

title: 'Castle Dracula': Inside Epstein's mansion where Trump dined and Chomsky wrote
content: It had all the trappings of wealth‚Äîheated sidewalks, a taxidermied tiger, seven floors of Versailles-by-way-of-psychodrama‚Äîand yet its most valuable commodity wasn‚Äôt luxury. It was leverage. Because Epstein didn‚Äôt just collect art or investments. He collected people.

title: Gemini vs Grok vs Claude vs DeepSeek: Which AI tool is best for chess?
content: Google's Kaggle Game Arena witnessed a thrilling start as Gemini 2.5 Pro, o4-mini, Grok 4, and o3 secured dominant victories in the AI chess exhibition tournament. These LLMs defeated formidable opponents, showcasing their strategic capabilities. Grok 4's impressive performance drew attention, with Elon Musk acknowledging xAI's minimal focus on chess.

title: Trump a Bihari? Fake certificate names US prez as Samastipur local
content: A bizarre incident in Bihar's Samastipur district has emerged during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, where an online application was filed claiming US President Donald Trump as a resident. The application included Trump's photo and his parents' names. Authorities rejected it and filed an FIR.

title: 'India contributes more than US': RBI guv on Trump's 'dead economy' jab
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra refuted Donald Trump's 'dead economy' remark, asserting India's strong economic performance and significant contribution to global growth, exceeding that of the United States. Despite concerns over potential US tariffs due to India's energy ties with Russia, Malhotra assured a stable inflation outlook, with authorities prepared to intervene if global oil prices rise to protect consumers.

title: Scooter DKS rode has Rs 18,500 in fines; owner pays Rs 1K after viral ride
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar faced scrutiny after riding a scooter with ‚Çπ18,500 in unpaid traffic fines during a Hebbal flyover inspection. The JD(S) party highlighted the pending fines and questioned the legality of the half-helmets worn by Shivakumar and his companion.

title: Hulk Hogan‚Äôs death: Cops address foul play concerns in WWE icon‚Äôs sudden death
content: Following Hulk Hogan's sudden death from cardiac arrest, his daughter Brooke Hogan speculated about foul play, citing concerns over improper medication and privacy violations by medical staff. Despite these concerns and the absence of an autopsy, Clearwater Police Department found no evidence of foul play.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Prasidh's coach: 'He played into England's hands initially, pulled off a 3-card trick later'
content: Prasidh Krishna's impressive comeback in the fifth Test against England, where he claimed eight wickets, played a crucial role in India's victory. After facing criticism and being dropped, Krishna refined his approach, displaying improved consistency and tactical awareness. His performance offers India confidence in his potential for Test matches, particularly in SENA countries, despite likely limited opportunities at home.

title: Bars in Andhra Pradesh allowed to operate until 11 p.m. as Cabinet approves new policy
content: Permits rooms allowed; new policy proposes a shift from auction system to lottery-based allocation; 10% of bar licences reserved for toddy tappers

title: Indofast Energy sets up 80 EV battery swap stations in two divisions of SCR, plans 40 more   ¬†
content: Of the 80, Secunderabad division hosts 56 facilities, while the remaining are under Hyderabad division

title: ‚ÄòDigital threads‚Äô tighten grip in Hyderabad as bazaars see dip in Rakhi sales
content: Demand surges across quick-commerce apps; footfall thins in traditional hotspots of Hyderabad, such as Begum Bazaar and Sultan Bazaar, which still brim with stalls of rakhi threads, decorative platters and gift boxes

title: Telangana to celebrate textile heritage, honour weavers on National Handloom Day on August 7
content: Sri Konda Laxman Bapuji Awards to be presented to selected weavers and designers; handloom exhibitions, public meetings with weaving communities and district-level programmes also planned

title: NHRC issues show-cause notice over stampede death at Pushpa 2 screening
content: Asks why it should not recommend a compensation of ‚Çπ5 lakh to the next of kin of woman who died in the December 4 stampede

title: Donald Trump from Samastipur: fake application rejected in Bihar
content: District administration lodges FIR, warns that any kind of deliberate wrong information or fraud can lead to application rejection as well as criminal prosecution

title: Hasdeo mining issue resurfaces in Chhattisgarh with ‚Äòclearance‚Äô for another project
content: The project potentially paves the way for the felling of 4.5 lakh trees, drawing criticism from Opposition parties and environmentalists

title: A.G. Noorani, Arundhati Roy‚Äôs books among 25 ‚Äòforfeited‚Äô by J&K Home Department
content: The department said these books deeply impact the psyche of youth by promoting a culture of grievance, victimhood and terrorist-heroism

title: Petrol lobbies behind E20 fuel fear campaign: Nitin Gadkari
content: Speaking at The Hindu‚Äôs Mind series, the Union Minister blames ‚Äúpolitical conspiracy‚Äù for social media outrage over shift to E20 and an expected surge in maintenance costs, while petrol prices remain unchanged

title: Mohan Majhi government prescribes new colour, closely resembling saffron, for government buildings in Odisha
content: Principal opposition party Biju Janata Dal slams the decision, says it is an attempt to distract attention from failures

title: Over 100 names ‚Äòmissing‚Äô from electoral rolls in Bihar‚Äôs Jehanabad
content: Residents, mostly from marginalised communities, claim deletion; officials assure rectification via Form 6

title: JNCASR research holds promise for curing Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease
content: This research involves novel therapeutic target and treatment options based on RNA and small molecules, which could potentially accelerate the drug discovery process

title: East Asia to be next focus of India‚Äôs major diplomatic outreach
content: The visit to Japan is significant as both countries are part of the Quad initiative that was launched by Australia, India, Japan and the United States in 2017

title: Woman gang-raped in M.P., four held
content: Police said the incident took place on August 5 afternoon when the woman and her friend visited a forested area; State Congress president slammed the government over ‚Äúhorror of cases of Dalit, tribal, and women‚Äôs oppression‚Äù

title: SC directs liquidation of regulatory assets owed to discoms over a four-year period
content: The judgment directed the State Regulatory Commissions to provide the trajectory and roadmap for liquidation of the existing regulatory assets

title: If Telangana‚Äôs BC reservation Bills don‚Äôt get approval, BJP will be proven anti-OBC: Revanth Reddy
content: He leads sit-in protest demanding the President‚Äôs consent for two Bills passed by the State Assembly that seek 42% reservations to Backward Classes in local body elections as well as in education and employment sectors

title: Refer sports Bills to Joint Parliamentary Committee: Opposition urges Lok Sabha Speaker
content: In a letter to the Speaker, the leaders said the Bills require more discussion ‚Äúin view of their national importance, the need for broad consensus, and the value of consulting relevant stakeholders‚Äù

title: Tensions erupt at Dadar‚Äôs Kabutarkhana over BMC action on pigeon feeding site
content: Protesters dismantle tarpaulin erected as per Bombay HC order; Minister Lodha condemns incident, urges restraint

title: Charred body of 20-year-old college girl found at her home in Odisha
content: Parents have alleged that their daughter was dissuaded from filing a police complaint against the person who was accused of blackmailing her

title: Trump's 50% tariff is economic blackmail: Rahul Gandhi
content: Soon after Donald Trump announced a penalty of another 25% on India for buying Russian oil, Rahul Gandhi said Prime Minister Narendra Modi should not let Indian interests be overridden

title: EC bonded labour of BJP, won‚Äôt allow any action against State govt. officers: Mamata
content: On August 5, the EC had sent a letter to the State Chief Secretary informing about the suspension of four government officials of the State for irregularities in the registration of names in the voter list

title: ‚ÄòNo ground‚Äô for case against Adoor, Kerala Police get legal opinion
content: However, several activists have signalled that they will move criminal miscellaneous petitions in  magistrate‚Äôs court demanding his prosecution.

title: SFI wins Kannur University union polls for 26th year in a row
content: SFI accuses rivals of rigging and illegal entry; KSU‚ÄìMSF blames SFI for abducting a university union councillor

title: MP appeals to MEA for repatriation of stranded Kakinada fishermen
content: The group of fishermen were caught by Sri Lanka on August 4 after they entered into Sri Lankan waters on their boat.¬†

title: Pinarayi Vijayan to hand over keys to 332 flats constructed for fisherfolk at Muttathara on August 7
content: The flats are part of the first phase of a 400-flat housing complex envisaged to rehabilitate fisherfolk displaced by recurring sea surges and erosion

title: SC begins hearing pleas of women Army officers denied permanent commissions
content: Women officers with short service commissions blame ‚Äúsystematic discrimination‚Äù in annual confidential reports and denial of equal opportunities, resulting in denial of permanent commissions

title: Woman drives her dream with KSRTC at Ponnani
content: Arya Nanda credits the KSRTC for opening the driving school‚Äôs doors to women, paving the way for a new generation of female drivers

title: Kalyana Karnataka Horata Samiti to present memorandum to Govind Rao Committee
content: The memorandum contains various aspects for consideration and inclusion in a report to be submitted by the Govind Rao Committee

title: Fishing gear a major source of ‚Äòmicroplastic‚Äô contamination along Indian coasts
content: Minister Jitendra Singh shares findings from surveys conducted by Ministry of Earth Sciences through  the National Centre for Coastal Research

title: Injured worker dies weeks after Gujarat bridge collapse, toll now 22
content: Following the tragedy, four engineers from the State‚Äôs Roads and Buildings Department were suspended for alleged negligence

title: Official apathy delays Central aid to families of Pettimudy landslip victims
content: Devikulam taluk officials have not submitted the necessary details to the  District Disaster Management Authority, delaying the aid, say DDMA sources. Kin say they have already submitted all the required details to the taluk office

title: Khandre says skill development for journalists, especially those in rural areas, is important
content: He inaugurates workshop for journalists from Kalyana Karnataka region organised by the Karnataka Media Academy in Bidar

title: Ambergris worth ‚Çπ2 crore seized in Ahmedabad; one held
content: Ahmedabad City Crime Branch arrests suspect; contraband linked to Mumbai-based associate still absconding

title: Govt. committed to transforming Andhra Pradesh into skill hub for solar and wind energy companies: Lokesh
content: Government to launch Naipunyam skill portal on September 1, aims at equipping youth with industry-relevant skills particularly in emerging sectors like the green and renewable energies

title: Deputy Mayor inaugurates renovated Aristo Road amid LDF boycott
content: The LDF leadership of the Thrissur Corporation council, including the Mayor and Standing Committee Chairman, abstained from the event. Deputy Mayor says infrastructure projects should not become battlegrounds for party politics

title: ‚ÄòSeeds of communal poison sown by RSS, BJP‚Äô blamed for poisoning drinking water in school
content: Minister Priyank Kharge asks whether people who poison children for getting a headmaster transferred can be called human beings

title: Global workshop on research potential of Hortus Malabaricus from Aug. 9
content: Workshop will bring together researchers, academicians, and policymakers to explore the relevance of the plants documented in the monumental 17th Century botanical treatise

title: Midway into monsoon season, Kerala yet to revise ‚Äòorange book‚Äô
content: An updated handbook has to be released ahead of every monsoon including the lessons learnt from the previous season. After last year‚Äôs catastrophic landslides in Wayanad, the govt. it yet to put in place a protocol for response to such situations

title: 30 girls of Gurukul school fall ill with diarrhoea in Nellore district
content: Two students are currently availing treatment at ICU of Nellore GGH, while the parents of other students have taken them to their homes, informs hospital superintendent

title: Omar seeks restoration of J&K‚Äôs Statehood, calls for ‚Äòcourse correction‚Äô
content: In a letter to political parties, the J&K Chief Minister wrote, ‚Äúessential course correction prevents us from sliding down a dangerous and slippery slope where the Statehood of our constituent States is no longer regarded as a foundational and sacred constitutional right‚Äù

title: Cabinet approves free bus ride for women in Andhra Pradesh from August 15
content: Under the ‚ÄòStree Shakti‚Äô initiative, which is one of the Super Six election promises, over 2.6 crore women, girl students, and transgender individuals can travel free of cost on APSRTC buses; Cabinet also approves ‚Çπ648.59 crore relief package for weavers, besides giving its nod to 150‚Äì200 units of free electricity for 40,808 hair-cutting saloons

title: Kerala Cabinet gives approval for MEDISEP Phase 2
content: Basic cover will be enhanced to ‚Çπ5 lakh. Nod for recommendation that MEDISEP be extended to employees and pensioners in PSUs, corporations, autonomous and statutory bodies and cooperative sector

title: Mock draft: QBs selected with five of first eight picks of 12-team PPR superflex
content: the first full week of preseason games is upon us . our fantasy team of analysts and editors took part in a 12-team superflex league with PPR scoring . field Yates went quarterback with his first two picks and Eric Moody used three of his first four selections .

title: Dharali destroyed: New drone footage shows horrifying extent of damage - watch
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Rams' Davante Adams 'outstanding' in practice vs. Cowboys
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action .

title: Explaining MLS' discovery rights: What were M√ºller's extra steps to Vancouver?
content: MLS commissioner don Garber speaks about the potential change to the league's schedule after the 2026 FIFA World Cup . atypical but significant mechanism in MLS's single-entity structure called the Discovery List . the regulation allows teams to "discover" and select up to five non-MLS players .

title: WNBA's CBA negotiations: Why revenue sharing is priority No. 1 and whether a lockout is realistic
content: a meeting with commissioner Cathy Engelbert and ownership representative in Indianapolis is "a missed opportunity" players wore "Pay Us What You Owe Us" T-shirts during warmups . the move got some criticism, too . retired WNBA legend Candace Parker said it wasn't a great look for the plaza .
